w:r.w:t: This lesson will teach your student about emotions and feelings.

It is a description of emotions beyond “happy” “Sad” and “mad.” It would be helpful to be prepared with further visual representations or illustrations of the mentioned emotions in this lesson. Focus on practice “being/present tense” (is, am, are) verbs and descriptive adverbs.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Describe the way they are feeling or other people are feeling
Speak more in depth about things that make them feel certain ways
in regards to subject and verb “being” and adverbial clauses
shy, confident, bored, excited, tired, energetic
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning and using (topic/concept)
Go through this poem and the motions with the student.
Act it out and have fun warming up with their actions.
Emotions are how we feel throughout the day
Have your student read the sentence and go over some of these emotion pictures
is when you feel quiet around people. You may not be sad, but you just feel quiet.
Have your student read these sentences to you. Demonstrate this experience and see if they might have some familiarity with shyness.
you feel like you can do ANYTHING! You are strong, smart, fast, and perfect.
Have the student read these sentences to you
you are tired of working and need to do something fun!
Have the student read these sentences to you and demonstrate boredom.
I was ______ when I had to speak in front of class today.
spend all day reading a book.
I was ________ after I had won every soccer game at school today.
Have the student fill in the blank with its correct word.
about fun things! Birthdays, holidays, friends, and games are
Have your student read these sentences and demonstrate excitement.
. If you do not sleep, you will feel
Demonstrate feeling tired and have your student read this for you. You might also ask if they can think of other
of things that make the tired.
happy and feel like doing a lot of things!
Explain the concept of energetic! Be exuberant and lively while presenting this concept. Ask if they can think of other energetic examples.
Which of these are not like the other?
Explain the differences between these different emotions.
Paul was feeling ________ when he did well at school!
Amy felt _______ because she did not sleep last night.
Shelby was _______ because her mom and dad were taking her on a trip to get a toy from the store.
Have your student read the sentences and fill in the blank with the correct word.
Fill in the blank with the correct letter
S, A, U, D, B, E, M, Z
Have your student fill in the blank with the correct letter to make it a word
Confident, Excited, Energetic, Tired, Bored, Shy, Feel, Emotions
Spell out each of these words, and you can even ask if they can spell these words from memory
Have your student draw a line between the rhyming words
Shy, Tired, Excited, Energetic, and Confident
This slide could have many different results. Let the student circle the emojis that seem the most appropriate to the feeling
How many Syllables are these words?
Have your student clap out these words and tell you how many syllables each word has
Match the word with the sentence:
I, She, We, You, He, They
Have your student fill out the correct grammatical phrase and practice the proper sentence structure.
He is _______ bored to do work.
Have your student fill in the correct homonym for the sentence.
Ask your student to read this little poem by themselves. If they
, read it with them or sing it to them and have them repeat after you.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
How would you describe these emotions?
How will you talk about these emotions?
Try to get your student to use each of these words in their own sentence.
